thread.title: West Coast Fever star shooter Caitlin Bassett refused entry to Qantas Club
thread.title_full: West Coast Fever star shooter Caitlin Bassett refused entry to Qantas Club

author: DANIELLE LE MESSURIER
title: West Coast Fever star shooter Caitlin Bassett refused entry to Qantas Club
text:
WEST Coast Fever star Caitlin Bassett has been refused entry to the Melbourne Qantas Club for wearing leggings and joggers.
The star shooter tweeted from the airport on Tuesday about 1pm: “Just got denied entry from Qantas Club for wearing leggings and joggers ... What do they expect me to wear on a 4 hr flight to Perth? A ball gown?”
A West Coast Fever spokeswoman said it was understood Ms Bassett had made it on to the plane.
The airline has been reminding its customers since April about smart casual dress guidelines, according to a Qantas spokesman.
“The vast majority of our members meet and exceed the guidelines, but we have had some feedback from customers that they want to see those guidelines apply to everyone,” the spokesman said.
“Our dress guidelines are nothing out of the ordinary.
“High visibility uniforms and sports uniforms are not affected, it’s just rubber thongs, singlets and gym wear ... as was the case with Ms Bassett.”
Just got denied from Qantas Club for wearing leggings & joggers...What do they expect me to wear on a 4 hr flight to Perth? A ball gown?
— Caitlin Bassett (@CBassNetball) June 30, 2015
@CBassNetball Hi Caitlin, a team member would like to get in touch with you. Please DM us your preferred contact number. Kristyn
— Qantas (@Qantas) June 30, 2015 It’s the second time in two months that a Perth woman has been denied entry into a Qantas business lounge.
A heavily pregnant Perth podiatrist was barred from entering the Perth Qantas business lounge in April because she was wearing Birkenstocks.
Qantas staff at Perth Airport told Chloe Wear that she was not allowed to enter The Qantas Club because her shoes did not have an ankle strap.
Originally published as Clothes Qantas wouldn’t allow
